content: अमृत {%<ab>a.</ab>%} {@--1@} Not dead; अमृते जारजः कुंडः <ls>Ak.</ls> {@--2@} Immortal; अपाम सोमममृता अभूम <ls>Rv. 8. 48. 3</ls>; <ls>U. 1. 1</ls>; <ls>Bg. 14. 27.</ls> {@--3@} Imperishable, indestructible, eternal. {@--4@} Causing immortality. {@--5@} Beautiful, agreeable, desired. --तः {@--1@} A god, an immortal, deity. {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of Dhanvantari, physician of the gods; also <ab>N.</ab> of Indra, of the sun, of Prajāpati, of the soul, Viṣṇu and Śiva. {@--3@} <ab>N.</ab> of a plant (वनमुद्ग). {@--4@} <ab>N.</ab> of the root of a plant (वाराहीकंद). --ता {@--1@} Spirituous liquor. {@--2@} <ab>N.</ab> of various plants; {%<ab>e. g.</ab>%} आमलकी, हरीतकी, गुडूची; मागधी; तुलसी, इंद्रवारुणी, ज्योतिष्मती, गोरक्षदुग्धा; अतिविषा; रक्तत्रिवृत्; दूर्वा, स्थूलमांसहरीतकी. {@--3@} <ab>N.</ab> of one of the Nāḍīs in the body; <ls>Māl. 5. 2.</ls> {@--4@} One of the rays of the sun; <ls>R. 10. 58.</ls> --तं {@--1@} ({%a%}) Immortality, imperishable state; न मृत्युरासीदमृतं न तर्हि <ls>Rv. 10. 129. 2</ls>; <ls>Ms. 12. 85.</ls> ({%b%}) Final beatitude, absolution; तपसा किल्बिषं हंति विद्ययामृतमश्नुते <ls>Ms. 12. 104</ls>; स श्रिये चामृताय च <ls>Ak.</ls> {@--2@} The collective body of immortals. {@--3@} ({%a%}) The world of immortality, Paradise, Heaven; the power of eternity, immortal light, eternity. {@--4@} Nectar of immortality, ambrosia, beverage of the gods (<ab>opp.</ab> विष) supposed to be churned out of the ocean; देवासुरैरमृतमंबुनिधिर्ममंथे <ls>Ki. 5. 30</ls>; विषादष्यमृतं ग्राह्यं <ls>Ms. 2. 239</ls>; विषमप्यमृतं क्वचिद्भवेदमृतं वा विषमीश्वरेच्छया <ls>R. 8. 46</ls>; <ab>oft.</ab> used in combination with words like वाच्, वचनं, वाणी &c; कुमारजन्मामृतसंमिताक्षरं <ls>R. 3. 16</ls>; आप्यायितोसौ वचनामृतेन <ls>Mb.</ls>; अमृतं शिशिरे वह्निरमृतं क्षीरभोजनं <ls>Pt. 1. 128</ls> the height of pleasure or gratification. {@--5@} The Soma juice. {@--6@} Antidote against poison. {@--7@} The residue or leavings of a sacrifice; (यज्ञशेष) <ls>Ms. 3. 285.</ls> {@--8@} Unsolicited alms, alms got without solicitation; मृतं स्याद्याचितं भैक्ष्यममृतं स्यादयाचितं <ls>Ms. 4. 4-5</ls>. {@--9@} Water; अमृताध्मातजीमूत <ls>U. 6. 21</ls>; अमृतादुन्मथ्यमानात् <ls>K. 136</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> also the formulas अमृतोपस्तरणमसि स्वाहा and अमृतापिधानमसि स्वाहा repeated by Brāhmaṇas at the time of sipping water before the commencement and at the end of meals. {@--10@} A drug. {@--11@} Clari fied butter; अमृतं नाम यत् संतो मंत्रजिह्वेषु जुह्वति <ls>Śi. 2. 107.</ls> {@--12@} Milk. {@--13@} Food in general. {@--14@} Boiled rice. {@--15@} Any thing sweet, any thing lovely or charming; a sweetmeat. {@--16@} Property. {@--17@} Gold. {@--18@} Quicksilver. {@--19@} Poison. {@--20@} The poison called वत्सनाभ. {@--21@} The Supreme Spirit (ब्रह्म). {@--22@} <ab>N.</ab> of a sacred place. {@--23@} <ab>N.</ab> of particular conjunctions of {%Nakṣatras%} (lunar asterisms) with week days (वारनक्षत्रयोग) or of lunar days with week days (तिथिवारयोग). {@--24@} The number four. {@--25@} Splendour, light. [<ab>cf.</ab> <ab>Gr.</ab> {%ambrotos%}, {%ambrosia%}; <ab>L.</ab> {%immortalis%}].
